channel.title: RTÉ - Mind Matters
channel.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
channel.description: Ella McSweeney looks at the workings of the human brain.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Ella McSweeney looks at the workings of the human brain.
channel.itunes:summary: Mind Matters is a science series that looks at the workings of the human brain and its ability to function and recover after trauma. From Alzheimer's disease to manic depression, strokes to autism - what does science know about how these conditions affect the brain and what are the treatments are currently available?

item.title: Mind Matters - On Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder is explored by Ella McSweeney through interviews with experts and sufferers.
item.itunes:subtitle: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder is explored by Ella McSweeney through interviews with experts and sufferers.
item.itunes:summary: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder is explored by Ella McSweeney through interviews with experts and sufferers.

item.title: Mind Matters - On Epilepsy
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Ella hears the story of Thomas, a 45 year old farmer from Co. Meath, who had epilepsy for fifteen years.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ella hears the story of Thomas, a 45 year old farmer from Co. Meath, who had epilepsy for fifteen years.
item.itunes:summary: Ella hears the story of Thomas, a 45 year old farmer from Co. Meath, who had epilepsy for fifteen years.

item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: At their most violent migraines are beyond medication. Ella McSweeney investigates
item.itunes:subtitle: At their most violent migraines are beyond medication. Ella McSweeney investigates

item.title: Mind Matters Podcast - On Huntington's Disease
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Huntington's Disease is a rare inherited brain disorder. Presented by Ella McSweeney.
item.itunes:subtitle: Huntington's Disease is a rare inherited brain disorder. Presented by Ella McSweeney.
item.itunes:summary: Huntington's Disease is a rare inherited brain disorder. Presented by Ella McSweeney.

item.title: Mind Matters - On Strokes
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Over 14,000 people in Ireland experience a stroke each year. How does a stroke affect the brain? Presented by Ella McSweeney
item.itunes:subtitle: Over 14,000 people in Ireland experience a stroke each year. How does a stroke affect the brain? Presented by Ella McSweeney
item.itunes:summary: Over 14,000 people in Ireland experience a stroke each year. How does a stroke affect the brain? Presented by Ella McSweeney

item.title: Mind Matters - On Autism
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Not only is it extremely difficult to define autism, but scientists have yet to discover its cause. Presented by Ella McSweeney
item.itunes:subtitle: Not only is it extremely difficult to define autism, but scientists have yet to discover its cause. Presented by Ella McSweeney
item.itunes:summary: Not only is it extremely difficult to define autism, but scientists have yet to discover its cause. Presented by Ella McSweeney

item.title: Mind Matters - On Manic Depression
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Manic Depression brings with it extreme highs and lows. What have scientists discovered about this condition?
item.itunes:subtitle: Manic Depression brings with it extreme highs and lows. What have scientists discovered about this condition?
item.itunes:summary: Manic Depression brings with it extreme highs and lows. What have scientists discovered about this condition?

item.title: Mind Matters - On Alzheimer's Disease
item.itunes:author: RTÉ:Ireland
item.description: Alzheimer’s Disease was identified nearly a century ago. What causes this condition and how near are we to a cure?
item.itunes:subtitle: Alzheimer’s Disease was identified nearly a century ago. What causes this condition and how near are we to a cure?
item.itunes:summary: Mind Matters, the science series, presented by Ella McSweeney, that looks at conditions of the human brain. This week - Alzheimer’s
